summary.span: 代表十進位數值。

span.span: Represents a decimal number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 實值型別表示十進位數字，範圍是從正 79228162514264337593543950335 到負 79228162514264337593543950335。The value type represents decimal numbers ranging from positive 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335 to negative 79,228,162,514,264,337,593,543,950,335. 預設值`Decimal`為 0。The default value of a `Decimal` is 0. 實值類型很適合需要大量的重要整數和小數的數字和沒有捨入誤差的財務計算。The value type is appropriate for financial calculations that require large numbers of significant integral and fractional digits and no round-off errors. 型別不排除捨入的需求。The type does not eliminate the need for rounding. 相反地，它最小化因為捨入錯誤。Rather, it minimizes errors due to rounding. 例如，下列程式碼產生的結果是 0.9999999999999999999999999999 而不是 1。For example, the following code produces a result of 0.9999999999999999999999999999 instead of 1. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cpp/decimal1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cs/DecimalDivision_46630_1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Class#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/vb/DecimalDivision_46630_1.vb#1)] 當除法和乘法的結果傳遞至方法時，結果會因不會遺失有效位數，如下列程式碼所示。When the result of the division and multiplication is passed to the method, the result suffers no loss of precision, as the following code shows. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cpp/decimal2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/cs/DecimalDivision_46630_1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Class/vb/DecimalDivision_46630_1.vb#2)] 十進位數字是正負號所組成的浮點值、 數字的值，其中每一個數字的值範圍從 0 到 9 和縮放比例，可指出分隔的整數和小數部分的浮動小數點的位置數字值。A decimal number is a floating-point value that consists of a sign, a numeric value where each digit in the value ranges from 0 to 9, and a scaling factor that indicates the position of a floating decimal point that separates the integral and fractional parts of the numeric value. 二進位表示法值組成 1 位元符號、 96 位元整數的數字，以及用來除 96 位元整數，並指定哪些部分是十進位小數的縮放比例。The binary representation of a value consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the 96-bit integer and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 縮放比例是隱含字 10，範圍從 0 到 28 的指數。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. 因此的二進位表示法值表單，((-296 296) / 10(0 至 28))，其中-(296-1)等於，和 296-1 會等於。Therefore, the binary representation of a value the form, ((-296 to 296) / 10(0 to 28)), where -(296-1) is equal to , and 296-1 is equal to . 如需有關的二進位表示法值和範例，請參閱建構函式和方法。For more information about the binary representation of values and an example, see the constructor and the method. 縮放比例因素也會保留任何尾端零數目。The scaling factor also preserves any trailing zeros in a number. 尾端的零不會影響值算術或比較運算中的數字。Trailing zeros do not affect the value of a number in arithmetic or comparison operations. 不過，尾端零可能會揭露所如果套用適當的格式字串的方法。However, trailing zeros might be revealed by the method if an appropriate format string is applied. ## 轉換考量Conversion Considerations 此類型提供轉換的方法值及與， ， ， ， ， ， ，和值。This type provides methods that convert values to and from , , , , , , , and values. 從這些整數類資料類型轉換會擴展轉換，永遠不會遺失資訊或擲回例外狀況。Conversions from these integral types to are widening conversions that never lose information or throw exceptions. 從不任何整數類資料類型縮小轉換的圓形到最接近的整數值趨近於零的值。Conversions from to any of the integral types are narrowing conversions that round the value to the nearest integer value toward zero. 某些語言，例如 C# 中，也支援的轉換值值。Some languages, such as C#, also support the conversion of values to values. 如果這些轉換的結果無法以目的型別，表示擲回例外狀況。If the result of these conversions cannot be represented in the destination type, an exception is thrown. 類型也會提供方法，來轉換值及與和值。The type also provides methods that convert values to and from and values. 從不至或縮小轉換，可能會遺失有效位數，但不是有關範圍的已轉換的值。Conversions from to or are narrowing conversions that might lose precision but not information about the magnitude of the converted value. 轉換不會擲回例外狀況。The conversion does not throw an exception. 從不或至擲回例外狀況，如果轉換的結果無法表示成。Conversions from or to throw an exception if the result of the conversion cannot be represented as a . ## 十進位值上執行的作業Performing Operations on Decimal Values 型別支援標準的數學運算，例如加法、 減法、 除法、 乘法和一元否定運算。The type supports standard mathematical operations such as addition, subtraction, division, multiplication, and unary negation. 您也可直接使用的二進位表示法藉由呼叫值方法。You can also work directly with the binary representation of a value by calling the method. 若要比較兩個值，您可以使用標準數值的比較運算子，或者您可以呼叫或方法。To compare two values, you can use the standard numeric comparison operators, or you can call the or method. 您也可以呼叫的成員類別以執行各種不同的數字的操作，包括取得絕對值的數字，判斷兩個最大或最小值取得數字符號和捨入的值數字。You can also call the members of the class to perform a wide range of numeric operations, including getting the absolute value of a number, determining the maximum or minimum value of two values, getting the sign of a number, and rounding a number. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範 的用法。The following code example demonstrates the use of . remarks.format: ## Remarks 二進位表示法數字組成 1 位元符號、 96 位元整數的數字，以及用來除以整數數字，並指定哪些部分是十進位小數的縮放比例。The binary representation of a number consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the integer number and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 縮放比例是隱含字 10，範圍從 0 到 28 的指數。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. `bits` 是 32 位元帶正負號整數的四個項目長陣列。`bits` is a four-element long array of 32-bit signed integers. `bits` [0]、 `bits` [1]，和`bits`[2] 包含 96 位元整數的低度、 中間名和高 32 位元。`bits` [0], `bits` [1], and `bits` [2] contain the low, middle, and high 32 bits of the 96-bit integer number. `bits` [3] 包含縮放比例和登入，並由下列部分組成：`bits` [3] contains the scale factor and sign, and consists of following parts: 位元 0 到 15 之間 facility，未使用，而且必須是零。Bits 0 to 15, the lower word, are unused and must be zero. 位元 16 到 23 必須包含介於 0 到 28，其指出 10 的次方，除整數數字的指數。Bits 16 to 23 must contain an exponent between 0 and 28, which indicates the power of 10 to divide the integer number. 位元 24 到 30 未使用，而且必須是零。Bits 24 to 30 are unused and must be zero. 31 位元包含符號;0 表示正數且 1 代表負數。Bit 31 contains the sign; 0 meaning positive, and 1 meaning negative. 數值可能會有幾個可能的二進位表示法。所有都同樣有效，而且數字相等。A numeric value might have several possible binary representations; all are equally valid and numerically equivalent. 請注意，位元表示區分負數和正數的零。Note that the bit representation differentiates between negative and positive zero. 這些值會被視為相等的所有作業中。These values are treated as being equal in all operations. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例會建立數個`Decimal`數字使用建構函式多載會初始化`Decimal`結構的四個陣列值。The following code example creates several `Decimal` numbers using the constructor overload that initializes a `Decimal` structure with an array of four values. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Ctor.Arrays#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Ctor.Arrays/CPP/ctoriarr.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Ctor.Arrays#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Ctor.Arrays/CS/ctoriarr.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Ctor.Arrays#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Ctor.Arrays/VB/ctoriarr.vb#1)]

Compiler overload resolution may account for an apparent difference in the behavior of the two method overloads. If an implicit conversion between the argument and a is defined and the argument is not typed as an , compilers may perform an implicit conversion and call the method. Otherwise, they call the method, which always returns if its argument is not a value. The following example illustrates the difference in behavior between the two method overloads. In the case of all primitive integral types, including both signed and unsigned types, the first comparison returns because the compiler automatically performs a widening conversion and calls the method, whereas the second comparison returns because the compiler calls the method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 二進位表示法數字組成 1 位元符號、 96 位元整數的數字，以及用來除以整數數字，並指定哪些部分是十進位小數的縮放比例。The binary representation of a number consists of a 1-bit sign, a 96-bit integer number, and a scaling factor used to divide the integer number and specify what portion of it is a decimal fraction. 縮放比例是隱含字 10，範圍從 0 到 28 的指數。The scaling factor is implicitly the number 10, raised to an exponent ranging from 0 to 28. 傳回值是 32 位元帶正負號整數的四個元素陣列。The return value is a four-element array of 32-bit signed integers. 第一、 第二，並傳回陣列中的第三個項目包含 96 位元整數的低度、 中間名和高 32 位元。The first, second, and third elements of the returned array contain the low, middle, and high 32 bits of the 96-bit integer number. 傳回陣列的第四個項目包含縮放比例並登入。The fourth element of the returned array contains the scale factor and sign. 它包含下列部分：It consists of the following parts: 位元 0 到 15 之間 facility，未使用，而且必須是零。Bits 0 to 15, the lower word, are unused and must be zero. 位元 16 到 23 必須包含介於 0 到 28，其指出 10 的次方，除整數數字的指數。Bits 16 to 23 must contain an exponent between 0 and 28, which indicates the power of 10 to divide the integer number. 位元 24 到 30 未使用，而且必須是零。Bits 24 to 30 are unused and must be zero. 31 位元包含符號： 0 表示正數，和 1 表示負數。Bit 31 contains the sign: 0 mean positive, and 1 means negative. 請注意，位元表示區分負數和正數的零。Note that the bit representation differentiates between negative and positive zero. 這些值會被視為相等的所有作業中。These values are treated as being equal in all operations. ## Examples 下列範例會使用`GetBits`方法，將轉換的數個`Decimal`成其對等二進位表示法的值。The following example uses the `GetBits` method to convert several `Decimal` values to their equivalent binary representations. 接著會顯示十進位值和十六進位值的項目中所傳回的陣列方法。It then displays the decimal values and the hexadecimal value of the elements in the array returned by the method. [!code-cpp[System.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type/CPP/getbits.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type/CS/getbits.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Decimal.Get_Bits_Hash_Type/VB/getbits.vb#2)] 下列範例會使用方法來擷取之元件部分的陣列。The following example uses the method to retrieve the component parts of an array. 然後它會使用這個陣列中的呼叫建構函式來具現化新值。It then uses this array in the call to the constructor to instantiate a new value. [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.decimal.ctor/cs/ctor2a.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.decimal.ctor/vb/ctor2a.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 參數`s`包含數字的格式：Parameter `s` contains a number of the form: [ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws][ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*、**,*|特定文化特性的千分位分隔符號。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| 參數`s`解譯使用樣式。Parameter `s` is interpreted using the style. 這表示泛空白字元和千位分隔符號所允許但不是貨幣符號。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要明確定義的項目 (例如貨幣符號、 千位分隔符號和空白字元) 可以出現在`s`，使用或方法。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use either the or the method. 參數`s`會剖析使用的格式設定資訊中初始化目前的系統文化特性。Parameter `s` is parsed using the formatting information in a initialized for the current system culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 若要剖析字串，使用其他文化特性格式資訊，請使用或方法。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other culture, use the or method. 如有必要，值`s`會四捨五入為最接近。If necessary, the value of `s` is rounded using rounding to nearest. A具有 29 個位數的有效位數。A has 29 digits of precision. 如果`s`代表有超過 29 個位數，但具有小數部分的範圍內的數字和，數字會四捨五入，不會被截斷，以使用四捨五入為最接近的 29 個位數。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在剖析作業期間出現分隔符號`s`參數，以及適用的貨幣或十進位數字和群組分隔符號是相同的則剖析作業會假設分隔符號是十進位的分隔符號，而不是群組分隔符號。If during a parse operation a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 如需分隔符號的詳細資訊，請參閱， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下列程式碼範例使用方法來剖析的字串表示法值。The following code example uses the method to parse string representations of values. are allowed in the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必須從位元旗標的組合列舉型別。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 下列不支援的成員：The following members are not supported: - - [ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws][ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space. 空白字元可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。White space can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag, and it can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| current culture's currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign. 符號可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標，而且可以出現在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The sign can appear at the value if `style` includes the flag.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*、**,*|特定文化特性的千分位分隔符號。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol. 目前文化特性的千分位分隔符號可出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The current culture's thousands separator can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol. digits ranging from 0 to 9. 小數點後數字才會出現在`s`才`style`包含旗標。Fractional digits can appear in `s` only if `style` includes the flag.| |*e**e*|'E' 或者 'E' 字元，表示此值會以指數標記法表示。The 'e' or 'E' character, which remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個多載方法通常用來將各種不同的方式來格式化的文字轉換值。This overload of the method is commonly used to convert text that can be formatted in a variety of ways to a value. 例如，它可以用來將由使用者 HTML 文字方塊中輸入數值的文字轉換。For example, it can be used to convert the text entered by a user into an HTML text box to a numeric value. `s`參數包含數字的格式：The `s` parameter contains a number of the form: [ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws][ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*、**,*|特定文化特性的千分位分隔符號。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `s`參數會使用解譯樣式。The `s` parameter is interpreted using the style. 這表示泛空白字元和千位分隔符號所允許但不是貨幣符號。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要明確定義的項目 (例如貨幣符號、 千位分隔符號和空白字元) 可以出現在`s`，使用方法。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use the method. `provider`參數是實作，例如或物件。The `provider` parameter is an implementation, such as a or object. `provider`參數提供用於剖析的特定文化特性資訊。The `provider` parameter supplies culture-specific information used in parsing. 如果 `provider` 是 `null`，則會使用執行緒目前的文化特性。If `provider` is `null`, the thread current culture is used. A物件具有 29 個位數的有效位數。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果`s`代表有超過 29 個位數，但具有小數部分的範圍內的數字和，數字會四捨五入，不會被截斷，以使用四捨五入為最接近的 29 個位數。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果發現中分隔符號`s`期間剖析作業，以及適用的貨幣或十進位數的參數和群組分隔符號都相同，剖析作業會假設分隔符號是十進位的分隔符號，而不是群組分隔符號。If a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter during a parse operation, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 如需分隔符號的詳細資訊，請參閱， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下列範例是按鈕 click 事件處理常式的 Web 表單。The following example is the button click event handler of a Web form. 它會使用所傳回的陣列屬性來判斷使用者的地區設定。It uses the array returned by the property to determine the user's locale. 它接著會執行個體化對應至該地區設定的物件。It then instantiates a object that corresponds to that locale. 所屬的物件物件隨後會傳遞至方法，將使用者轉換的輸入來值。The object that belongs to that object is then passed to the method to convert the user's input to a value. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法的行為遵循 IEEE 標準 754，第 4 節。The behavior of this method follows IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 這種捨入亦稱為*四捨五入一半甚至*或*銀行進位*。This kind of rounding is sometimes called *round half to even* or *banker's rounding*. 它會將一致四捨五入單向中中間的四捨五入錯誤降至最低。It minimizes rounding errors that result from consistently rounding a midpoint value in a single direction. 它相當於呼叫方法`mode`引數的。It is equivalent to calling the method with a `mode` argument of . ## Examples 下列範例會將一連串介於 100 到 102 為最接近整數的值。The following example rounds a range of values between 100 and 102 to the nearest integer. 因為此方法會使用成雙，請注意，100.5 捨入至 100 和 101.5 會四捨五入至 102。Because the method uses banker's rounding, note that 100.5 rounds to 100 and 101.5 rounds to 102. [!code-csharp[System.Decimal.Round#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Decimal.Round/cs/Round1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Decimal.Round#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Decimal.Round/vb/Round1.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法相當於呼叫方法`mode`引數的。當`d`正中間時兩個捨入值，結果會捨入的小數點右邊有偶數的數字的值。This method is equivalent to calling the method with a `mode` argument of .When `d` is exactly halfway between two rounded values, the result is the rounded value that has an even digit in the far right decimal position. 例如，在四捨五入為兩個小數位數時，值 2.345 會變成 2.34，而值 2.355 會變成 2.36。For example, when rounded to two decimals, the value 2.345 becomes 2.34 and the value 2.355 becomes 2.36. 這個程序稱為*傾向偶數捨*，或*銀行進位*。This process is known as *rounding toward even*, or *banker's rounding*. 它會將一致四捨五入單向中中間的四捨五入錯誤降至最低。It minimizes rounding errors that result from consistently rounding a midpoint value in a single direction. ## Examples 下列範例會將數個`Decimal`值使用的小數位數的指定數目`Round`方法。The following example rounds several `Decimal` values to a specified number of decimal places using the `Round` method. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在的中點值，結果中的最小顯著性數字後的值會是精確之間的一半兩個數字。In a midpoint value, the value after the least significant digit in the result is precisely half way between two numbers. 比方說，7.5 中點值。 如果捨入到整數For example, 7.5 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded to an integer. 中間值的最接近的值無法輕鬆地識別沒有捨入的慣例，由所指定`mode`引數。For midpoint values, the nearest value can't be easily identified without a rounding convention, which is specified by the `mode` argument. 方法支援兩種捨入慣例來處理中點值。The method supports two rounding conventions for handling midpoint values. 背離零四捨五入。Rounding away from zero. 中間點的值會捨去遠離零的下一個編號。Midpoint values are rounded to the next number away from zero. 例如，3.5 會進位為 4，5 4.5 則四捨五入，-3.5 捨入為-4，和-4.5 捨入至-5。For example, 3.5 rounds to 4, 4.5 rounds to 5, -3.5 rounds to -4, and -4.5 rounds to -5. 這種形式的捨入由列舉成員。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 背離零四捨五入是最廣泛已知的形式的捨入。Rounding away from zero is the most widely known form of rounding. 捨入為偶數，或成雙Rounding to even, or banker's rounding 中間值會四捨五入至最接近的偶數。Midpoint values are rounded to the nearest even number. 例如，捨入為 4，3.5 和 4.5，與-3.5 和-4.5 則四捨五入到-4。For example, both 3.5 and 4.5 round to 4, and both -3.5 and -4.5 round to -4. 這種形式的捨入由列舉成員。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 四捨五入為最接近是捨入財務和統計作業中使用的標準形式。Rounding to nearest is the standard form of rounding used in financial and statistical operations. 其符合標準 ieee-754，第 4 節。It conforms to IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 多個的捨入運算中使用時，它會減少因一致四捨五入單向中的點值捨入錯誤。When used in multiple rounding operations, it reduces the rounding error that is caused by consistently rounding midpoint values in a single direction. 在某些情況下，此捨入錯誤可能十分顯著。In some cases, this rounding error can be significant. ## Examples 下列範例顯示傳回的值方法，方法`mode`引數的，而方法`mode`引數的。The following example displays values returned by the method, the method with a `mode` argument of , and the method with a `mode` argument of . remarks.format: ## Remarks `decimals`參數傳回的值中指定的有效小數位數，範圍從 0 到 28。The `decimals` parameter specifies the number of significant decimal places in the return value and ranges from 0 to 28. 如果`decimals`為零，則會傳回一個整數。If `decimals` is zero, an integer is returned. 在的中點值，結果中的最小顯著性數字後的值會是精確之間的一半兩個數字。In a midpoint value, the value after the least significant digit in the result is precisely half way between two numbers. 例如，3.47500 是中間值，如果要進位的兩個小數位數，而且 7.500 是中間值，如果是要四捨五入成整數。For example, 3.47500 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded two decimal places, and 7.500 is a midpoint value if it is to be rounded to an integer. 在這些情況下，最接近的值無法輕鬆地識別沒有捨入的慣例，由指定`mode`引數。In these cases, the nearest value can't be easily identified without a rounding convention, which is specified by the `mode` argument. 方法支援兩種捨入慣例來處理中點值。The method supports two rounding conventions for handling midpoint values. 背離零四捨五入。Rounding away from zero. 中間點的值會捨去遠離零的下一個編號。Midpoint values are rounded to the next number away from zero. 比方說，3.75 捨入至 3.8 3.85 四捨五入到 3.9，-3.75 捨入至-3.8，和-3.85 捨入至-3.9。For example, 3.75 rounds to 3.8, 3.85 rounds to 3.9, -3.75 rounds to -3.8, and -3.85 rounds to -3.9. 這種形式的捨入由列舉成員。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 背離零四捨五入是最廣泛已知的形式的捨入。Rounding away from zero is the most widely known form of rounding. 捨入為偶數，或成雙Rounding to even, or banker's rounding 中間值會四捨五入至最接近的偶數。Midpoint values are rounded to the nearest even number. 例如，3.75 和 3.85 四捨五入 3.8 與-3.75 和-3.85 捨入-3.8。For example, both 3.75 and 3.85 round to 3.8, and both -3.75 and -3.85 round to -3.8. 這種形式的捨入由列舉成員。This form of rounding is represented by the enumeration member. 四捨五入為最接近是捨入財務和統計作業中使用的標準形式。Rounding to nearest is the standard form of rounding used in financial and statistical operations. 其符合標準 ieee-754，第 4 節。It conforms to IEEE Standard 754, section 4. 多個的捨入運算中使用時，它會減少因一致四捨五入單向中的點值捨入錯誤。When used in multiple rounding operations, it reduces the rounding error that is caused by consistently rounding midpoint values in a single direction. 在某些情況下，此捨入錯誤可能十分顯著。In some cases, this rounding error can be significant. ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用方法列舉型別。The following example demonstrates how to use the method with the enumeration. remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法格式使用目前文化特性的慣例來指定格式的值。The method formats a value in a specified format by using the conventions of the current culture. 如果您想要使用預設值 （"G"或一般） 格式或指定不同的文化特性，使用的其他多載方法，如下所示：If you want to use the default ("G", or general) format or specify a different culture, use the other overloads of the method, as follows: |若要使用格式To use format|文化特性For culture|使用的多載Use the overload| |-------------------|-----------------|----------------------| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|預設值 （目前） 的文化特性Default (current) culture|| |預設值 ("G") 格式Default ("G") format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| |以特定格式A specific format|特定文化特性A specific culture|| 方法會使用所指定的標準或自訂數值格式字串`format`參數，以將目前的執行個體的值轉換成其字串表示。The method uses the standard or custom numeric format string specified by the `format` parameter to convert the value of the current instance into its string representation. `format`參數可以是任何有效[標準數值格式規範](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)除了 D、 R、 和 X，以及任何的組合[自訂數值格式規範](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。The `format` parameter can be any valid [standard numeric format specifier](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) except for D, R, and X, as well as any combination of [custom numeric format specifiers](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). 如果`format`是`null`或空字串，傳回這個執行個體的值會格式化為具有一般數值格式規範 (G)。If `format` is `null` or an empty string, the return value of this instance is formatted with the general numeric format specifier (G). .NET Framework 提供廣泛的格式化支援，下列格式的主題中的更詳細地說明：The .NET Framework provides extensive formatting support, which is described in greater detail in the following formatting topics: - 如需有關數值格式規範的詳細資訊，請參閱[標準數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md)和[自訂數值格式字串](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md)。For more information about numeric format specifiers, see [Standard Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/standard-numeric-format-strings.md) and [Custom Numeric Format Strings](~/docs/standard/base-types/custom-numeric-format-strings.md). - 如需格式的詳細資訊，請參閱[格式化型別](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md)。For more information about formatting, see [Formatting Types](~/docs/standard/base-types/formatting-types.md). 傳回值使用格式化目前的文化特性的物件。The return value is formatted by using the object for the current culture. 若要套用指定的文化特性的格式化慣例，呼叫方法。To apply the formatting conventions of a specified culture, call the method. ## Examples 下列範例會顯示值使用每個支援標準數值格式規範，以及兩個自訂數值格式字串。The following example displays a value using each of the supported standard numeric format specifiers, together with two custom numeric format strings. 將數字的值轉換成字串，此範例會使用 EN-US 文化特性的格式設定慣例。In converting the numeric values to strings, the example uses the formatting conventions of the en-US culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個多載不同於藉由傳回布林值，指出是否剖析作業成功而不是傳回的已剖析的數字值的方法。This overload differs from the method by returning a Boolean value that indicates whether the parse operation succeeded instead of returning the parsed numeric value. 它不需要使用例外狀況處理來測試的`s`無效，無法成功剖析。It eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a in the event that `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. 參數`s`包含數字的格式：Parameter `s` contains a number of the form: [ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws][ws][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][ws] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*、**,*|特定文化特性的千分位分隔符號。A culture-specific thousands separator symbol.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| 參數`s`解譯使用樣式。Parameter `s` is interpreted using the style. 這表示泛空白字元和千位分隔符號所允許但不是貨幣符號。This means that white space and thousands separators are allowed but currency symbols are not. 若要明確定義的項目 (例如貨幣符號、 千位分隔符號和空白字元) 可以出現在`s`，使用方法多載。To explicitly define the elements (such as currency symbols, thousands separators, and white space) that can be present in `s`, use the method overload. 參數`s`會剖析使用的格式設定資訊中物件初始化為目前的系統文化特性。Parameter `s` is parsed using the formatting information in a object initialized for the current system culture. 如需詳細資訊，請參閱。For more information, see . 若要剖析字串以使用其他的格式設定資訊指定文化特性，請使用方法多載。To parse a string using the formatting information of some other specified culture, use the method overload. 如有必要，值`s`會四捨五入為最接近。If necessary, the value of `s` is rounded using rounding to nearest. A物件具有 29 個位數的有效位數。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果`s`代表有超過 29 個位數，但具有小數部分的範圍內的數字和，數字會四捨五入，不會被截斷，以使用四捨五入為最接近的 29 個位數。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果在剖析作業期間出現分隔符號`s`參數，以及適用的貨幣或十進位數字和群組分隔符號是相同的則剖析作業會假設分隔符號是十進位的分隔符號，而不是群組分隔符號。If during a parse operation a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 如需分隔符號的詳細資訊，請參閱， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下列範例會使用方法，將數值的字串表示轉換值。The following example uses the method to convert the string representations of numeric values to values. 它會假設該 EN-US 是目前的文化特性。It assumes that en-US is the current culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個多載不同於藉由傳回布林值，指出是否剖析作業成功而不是傳回的已剖析的數字值的方法。This overload differs from the method by returning a Boolean value that indicates whether the parse operation succeeded instead of returning the parsed numeric value. 它不需要使用例外狀況處理來測試的`s`無效，無法成功剖析。It eliminates the need to use exception handling to test for a in the event that `s` is invalid and cannot be successfully parsed. `style`參數定義的允許格式`s`剖析作業成功的參數。The `style` parameter defines the allowable format of the `s` parameter for the parse operation to succeed. 它必須從位元旗標的組合列舉型別。It must be a combination of bit flags from the enumeration. 下列不支援的成員：The following members are not supported: - - 根據的樣式值`s`參數可以包含下列項目：Depending on the value of style, the `s` parameter may include the following elements: [ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws][ws][$][sign][digits,]digits[.fractional-digits][e[sign]digits][ws] 在方括號 ([ 和 ]) 中的項目是選擇性的項目。Elements in square brackets ([ and ]) are optional. 下表說明每個元素。The following table describes each element. |元素Element|描述Description| |-------------|-----------------| |*ws**ws*|選擇性的泛空白字元。Optional white space. 空白字元可以出現在開頭`s`如果`style`包含旗標。White space can appear at the beginning of `s` if `style` includes the flag. 它可以出現在結尾`s`如果`style`包含旗標。It can appear at the end of `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*$*|特定文化特性的貨幣符號。A culture-specific currency symbol. 在字串中的位置由定義或屬性所傳回物件方法`provider`參數。Its position in the string is defined by the or properties of the object returned by the method of the `provider` parameter. 貨幣符號可以出現在`s`如果`style`包含旗標。The currency symbol can appear in `s` if `style` includes the flag.| |*簽署**sign*|選擇性的符號。An optional sign.| |*digits**digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| |*.**.*|特定文化特性的小數點符號。A culture-specific decimal point symbol.| |*fractional-digits**fractional-digits*|範圍從 0 到 9 的數字序列。A sequence of digits ranging from 0 to 9.| `style`參數指定的允許的格式`s`參數，而且可以是下列一或多個列舉常數的使用位元 OR 運算結合在一起。The `style` parameter specifies the permitted format of the `s` parameter, and can be one or more enumerated constants combined using a bitwise OR operation. 如果`style`為 null，`s`解譯使用樣式。If `style` is null, `s` is interpreted using the style. `provider`參數是實作這類或物件。The `provider` parameter is an implementation such as a or object. `provider`參數提供用於剖析的特定文化特性資訊。The `provider` parameter supplies culture-specific information used in parsing. 如果 `provider` 是 `null`，則會使用執行緒目前的文化特性。If `provider` is `null`, the thread current culture is used. A物件具有 29 個位數的有效位數。A object has 29 digits of precision. 如果`s`代表有超過 29 個位數，但具有小數部分的範圍內的數字和，數字會四捨五入，不會被截斷，以使用四捨五入為最接近的 29 個位數。If `s` represents a number that has more than 29 digits, but has a fractional part and is within the range of and , the number is rounded, not truncated, to 29 digits using rounding to nearest. 如果發現中分隔符號`s`期間剖析作業，以及適用的貨幣或十進位數的參數和群組分隔符號都相同，剖析作業會假設分隔符號是十進位的分隔符號，而不是群組分隔符號。If a separator is encountered in the `s` parameter during a parse operation, and the applicable currency or number decimal and group separators are the same, the parse operation assumes that the separator is a decimal separator rather than a group separator. 如需分隔符號的詳細資訊，請參閱， ， ，和。For more information about separators, see , , , and . ## Examples 下列範例示範如何使用方法來剖析具有特定樣式，並使用特定文化特性的慣例來格式化數字的字串表示。The following example demonstrates the use of the method to parse the string representation of a number that has a particular style and is formatted using the conventions of a particular culture.
